intro: Adinandra clemensiae, commonly known as the KwaZulu-Natal ironwood, is a small evergreen tree native to the eastern regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant is notable for its hard, durable wood, which has been traditionally used for construction and tool-making. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
